page.title: 11Agriculture in the area
page.content: The agriculture of the area consists of{mixed,stock}and{dairy farming.} Mixed farming occupies the largest amount of the area, it consists of{ {sheep, beef cattle}and{arable crops.} potatoes and turnips are the most common root crops and, with barley are grown to provide winter fodder. The next greatest land-use is sheep farming, many sheep farmers keep beef cattle also,the main varieties being { {Limousin}and{Charolais.}The main breeds of sheep are{Swaledales}and{ {Herdwicks.}The sheep farmers also grow fodder crops for their animals in winter. The smallest agricultural land-use in the area is dairying. Some fodder crops are cultivated and a small number of the farmers breed{pedigree {Friesian cattle. { }
